DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Steroid Compound Anti-inflammatory Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator regarding administration of anti-inflammatory (steroid) hormonal therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Steroid Compound Anti-inflammatory Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of a steriod, a group of polycyclic compounds closely related biochemically to TERPENES, therapeutic agent to produce an anti-inflammatory effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A group of polycyclic compounds closely related biochemically to TERPENES. They include cholesterol, numerous hormones, precursors of certain vitamins, bile acids, alcohols (STEROLS), and certain natural drugs and poisons. Steroids have a common nucleus, a fused, reduced 17-carbon atom ring system, cyclopentanoperhydrophenanthrene. Most steroids also have two methyl groups and an aliphatic side-chain attached to the nucleus. (From Hawley's Condensed Chemical Dictionary, 11th ed):Having to do with reducing inflammation.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Compounds possessing the skeleton of cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene or a skeleton derived therefrom by one or more bond scissions or ring expansions or contractions. Methyl groups are normally present at C-10 and C-13. An alkyl side chain may also be present at C-17.  They include cholesterol, numerous hormones, precursors of certain vitamins, bile acids, alcohols (STEROLS), and certain natural drugs and poisons.
Having to do with reducing inflammation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.
